text.0: when thou o sun this day arising sinless shalt speak the truth to varuṇa and mitra.
text.1: o aditi may all the deities love us and thou o aryaman while we are singing.
text.2: looking on man o varuṇa and mitra this sun ascendeth up by both the pathways.
text.3: guardian of all things fixt of all that moveth beholding good and evil acts of mortals.
text.4: he from their home hath yoked the seven gold coursers who dropping oil and fatness carry sūrya.
text.5: yours varuṇa and mitra he surveyeth the worlds and living creatures like a herdsman.
text.6: your coursers rich in store of sweets have mounted to the bright ocean sūrya hath ascended.
text.7: for whom the Ādityas make his pathway ready aryaman mitra varuṇa accordant.
text.8: for these even aryaman varuṇa and mitra are the chastisers of all guile and falsehood.
text.9: these aditis sons infallible and mighty have waxen in the home of law eternal.
text.10: these mitra varuṇa whom none deceiveth with great power quicken even the fool to wisdom.
text.11: and wakening moreover thoughtful insight lead it by easy paths oer grief and trouble.
text.12: they ever vigilant with eyes that close not caring for heaven and earth lead on the thoughtless.
text.13: even in the rivers bed there is a shallow across this broad expanse may they conduct us.
text.14: when aditi and varuṇa and mitra like guardians give sudās their friendly shelter.
text.15: granting him sons and lineal succession let us not bold ones move the gods to anger.
text.16: may he with ofierings purify the altar from any stains of varuṇas reviler.
text.17: aryaman save us us all those who hate us give room and freedom to sudās ye mighty.
text.18: hid from our eyes is their resplendent meeting by their mysterious might they hold dominion.
text.19: heroes we cry trembling in fear before you even in the greatness of your power have mercy.
text.20: he who wins favour for his prayer by worship that he may gain him strength and highest riches.
text.21: that good mans mind the mighty ones will follow they have brought comfort to his spacious dwelling.
text.22: this priestly task gods varuṇa and mitra hath been performed for you at sacrifices.
text.23: convey us safely over every peril preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
